title: Essentials of Business Statistics (5th Ed)(gnv64)
description:
McGraw-Hill Education | January 2014 | ISBN-10: 0078020530 | 656 Pages | PDF | 46.4 mb

The primary goal of Essentials of Business Statistics is to illustrate an accurate view of business statistics in a way that students can easily understand. This is achieved in the following ways:
- New statistical topics and tools are introduced by using continuing case studies. This approach helps to alleviate student anxiety in learning new concepts and enhances overall comprehension
- Streamlined and clarified coverage of graphical and numerical methods
- New graphically based procedures for finding confidence intervals and performing hypothesis tests
- Increased emphasis on Excel and MINITAB with improved and updated step-by-step instructions in the end of chapter material
- Connect Business Statistics homework management 

Connect is the only integrated learning system that empowers students by continuously adapting to deliver precisely what they need, when they need it, and how they need it, so that your class time is more engaging and effective.

CONTENTS
Chapter 1 An Introduction to Business Statistics 2
Chapter 2 Descriptive Statistics: Tabular and Graphical Methods 34
Chapter 3 Descriptive Statistics: Numerical Methods 98
Chapter 4 Probability 150
Chapter 5 Discrete Random Variables 184
Chapter 6 Continuous Random Variables 220
Chapter 7 Sampling and Sampling Distributions 258
Chapter 8 Confidence Intervals 290
Chapter 9 Hypothesis Testing 326
Chapter 10 Statistical Inferences Based on Two Samples Experimental Design and Analysis of Variance 370
Chapter 12 Chi-Square Tests 440
Chapter 13 Simple Linear Regression Analysis 464
Chapter 14 Multiple Regression and Model Building 524
Appendix A Statistical Tables 598
Answers to Most Odd-Numbered Exercises 619
References 626
Photo Credits 628
Index 629
Chapter 15 Process Improvement Using Control Charts On Website
